sentences.sentence: What qualifies someone to be president, anyway?Listen to and follow 'Matter of Opinion'Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Amazon MusicWho's your ideal American president?
A strategic thinker who is calm in a crisis?

Perhaps a principled leader with an unwavering moral compass?This week, the hosts discuss what voters expect from “America's daddy” and whether concerns about President Biden's and Donald Trump's fitness are overblown, given the history of the office they each hope to keep or retake.
(A full transcript of this audio essay will be available within 24 hours of publication in the audio player above.

)Mentioned in this episode:·“Unmaking the Presidency: Donald Trump's War on the World's Most Powerful Office,” by Susan Hennessey and Benjamin Wittes·“Joe Biden: The Life, the Run, and What Matters Now,” by Evan Osnos“Unmaking the Presidency: Donald Trump's War on the World's Most Powerful Office,” by Susan Hennessey and Benjamin Wittes“Joe Biden: The Life, the Run, and What Matters Now,” by Evan OsnosThoughts?

Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.com.Follow our hosts on X: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT) and Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT).“Matter of Opinion” is produced by Derek Arthur, Sophia Alvarez Boyd and Phoebe Lett.
It is edited by Jordana Hochman.
Original music by Isaac Jones, Efim Shapiro, Carole Sabouraud, Sonia Herrero and Pat McCusker.
Our fact-checking team is Kate Sinclair, Mary Marge Locker and Michelle Harris.
Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.
Our executive producer is Annie-Rose Strasser.PHOTO: (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; Photograph by Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: What qualifies someone to be president, anyway?Listen to and follow ‘Matter of Opinion’Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Amazon MusicWho’s your ideal American president? A strategic thinker who is calm in a crisis? A charmer with boundless aplomb? Perhaps a principled leader with an unwavering moral compass?This week, the hosts discuss what voters expect from “America’s daddy” and whether concerns about President Biden’s and Donald Trump’s fitness are overblown, given the history of the office they each hope to keep or retake.(A full transcript of this audio essay will be available within 24 hours of publication in the audio player above.)Mentioned in this episode:•“Unmaking the Presidency: Donald Trump’s War on the World’s Most Powerful Office,” by Susan Hennessey and Benjamin Wittes•“Joe Biden: The Life, the Run, and What Matters Now,” by Evan Osnos“Unmaking the Presidency: Donald Trump’s War on the World’s Most Powerful Office,” by Susan Hennessey and Benjamin Wittes“Joe Biden: The Life, the Run, and What Matters Now,” by Evan OsnosThoughts? Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.com.Follow our hosts on X: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT) and Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT).“Matter of Opinion” is produced by Derek Arthur, Sophia Alvarez Boyd and Phoebe Lett. It is edited by Jordana Hochman. Mixing by Carole Sabouraud. Original music by Isaac Jones, Efim Shapiro, Carole Sabouraud, Sonia Herrero and Pat McCusker. Our fact-checking team is Kate Sinclair, Mary Marge Locker and Michelle Harris. Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski. Our executive producer is Annie-Rose Strasser.PHOTO:  (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; Photograph by Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)
